page.title: 09ST.BASIL'S J. SCHOOL-WIDNES
page.content: { St.Basil's school}was built sixteen years ago,at about the same time as the{Upton Estate}to accomodate families from sub_standard dwellings in both{Widnes}and{Liverpool. There are 160 children in the school and no longer are the different backgrounds of the children obvious -no "Scouse"accents as there were when the school was in its infancy.The community is stable and most families envisage staying permanently in Upton. Some of the children,are brought by bus from other areas of Widnes. Many fathers are unemployed or low paid but the children are well dressed in their grey and blue uniforms.At eleven most children continue there education at either{SS Fisher More {High School}or{St.Joseph's High School in{Widnes}although some go to fee paying schools in{Liverpool.
